title: Abdominal/Abdomen
description: One section of the body structure; position varies between organisms.

title: Abiotic
description: Component of an environment that is non-living.

title: Algae
description: A simple aquatic plant that contains chlorophyll, but lack leaves, roots and vascular tissue.

title: Antennae
description: A pair of sensory structures that are used to sense touch, smell, taste and temperature.

title: Benthic
description: Bottom of a water body.

title: Biotic
description: Component of as environment that is living.

title: Carapace
description: Hard dorsal part of an exoskeleton.

title: Carnivorous
description: Feeds on animal matter.

title: Copepods
description: Small microscopic aquatic crustacean.

title: Crustaceans
description: A group of organisms typical covered in a hard shell (yabbies, crabs, shrimp).

title: Detitivorous
description: An organism that feeds on and breaks down dead plant and animal matter. They are essential to returning nutrients to the ecosystem.

title: Detritus
description: Waste from plants or animals.

title: Elytra
description: Hard forewings used to protect the membranous hind wings of insects in the order Colepotera.

title: Filter feeding
description: Feed by straining suspended matter from water.

title: Gill
description: The respiratory organ of aquatic animals, as fish, that breathe oxygen dissolved in water.

title: Herbivorous
description: An organism that feeds on plant matter only.

title: Hydrophobic
description: Tends to repel or fails to mix with water.

title: Inverterbrate
description: An animal lacking a backbone.

title: Larva
description: Early stage in the lifecycle of some organisms.

title: Macrophytes
description: An aquatic plant that can be seen with the naked eye.

title: Omnivorous
description: An organism that feeds on plant and animal matter.

title: Organism
description: Any living plant, animal or single celled life form (or groups of).

title: Oxygenated
description: Enriched with oxygen.

title: Parasitic
description: An organism that lives as a parasite (lives on or in another organism and benefits at the hosts expense).

title: Phytoplankton
description: Freely floating (often minute) plants that drift with water currents.

title: Predatory
description: An organism that hunts, captures and consumes another species.

title: Pronotum
description: Upper surface of the prothorax (segment of the insect behind the head).

title: Prothorax
description: The first part of the thorax of an insect. Usually has the first set of legs attached.

title: Rostrum
description: Elongated piercing and sucking mouthparts of insects in the order Hemiptera.

title: Sediment
description: Solid particles that settle out of a liquid mixture; minerals weathered or precipitated and accumulate on the beds of waterways.

title: Silt
description: Fine sand/clay  (sedimentary particles) that are carried by running water, and eventually sink to the bottom of a water body.

title: Siphon
description: A tubular organ of the respiratory system of some insects that is used as a breathing tube.

title: Species
description: A group or organisms capable of breeding and producing fertile offspring.

title: Stagnant
description: A body of water that has an unpleasant smell as a result of the lack of water movement.

title: Substrate
description: The surface on which an organism grows on, or is attached to.

title: Tarsi
description: Feet of an insect which sometimes ends in claws.

title: Tentacles
description: Unsegmented flexible limbs/appendages used to grasp food or assist in moving.

title: Vegetation
description: Plants in the environment.

title: Vertebrate
description: Groups of animals distinguished through the possession of a backbone/spinal column.

title: Wetlands
description: An area of land consisting of marshes and swamps (saturated land).

title: Zooplankton
description: Freely floating (often minute) animals that drift with water currents.
